intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium subinforme, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 40 centimeters. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. The leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs.
